DataElement.preferredName: Patient Specimen Availability Or Biopsy Consent Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions addressing archived specimens or the willingness of the patient to consent to a biopsy procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Specimen Availability Or Biopsy Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._Permission to do something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is adequate archival tissue f
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is adequate archival tissue from a biopsy performed after progression of disease on previous EGFR-TKI available or is patient willing to consent to a fresh tumor biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor specimen with adequate tumor tissue (either one paraffin embedded tissue block OR 10 5-micron unstained slides from the block on regular (non-plus) slides and 1 H&E slide) available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is adequate archival tissue from a biopsy performed after progression of disease on previous EGFR-TKI available or is patient willing to undergo a new tumor biopsy prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pretreatment biopsy, either fresh (optimal) or archival (acceptable) available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tumor tissue for proposed correlative studies accessible?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have fresh or archived tumor tissue available for molecular marker testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient, who is enrolled in phase 2 portion of study, have archival tumor tissue available for analysis and willing to have tumor biopsy at baseline and at cycle 1, day 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to consent to allow access to known archival tumor tissue?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor tissue available for molecular marker testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tumor specimen available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient provided tumor sample for KRAS analysis or is willing to undergo mandatory screening biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the availability of a formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor specimen with adequate tumor tissue (either one paraffin embedded tissue block OR 10 5-micron unstained slides from the block on regular (non-plus) slides and 1 H&E slide) been confirmed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient provided archival tissue block or paraffin sample from archival tissue block (approximately 10 sections) for use in pharmacodynamic correlative studies (NOT required for patients enrolled on the dose escalation for intermittent ABT-888 portion of the study)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is adequate archival tissue available (metastatic tissue sample is preferable but primary tumor tissue will be acceptable) or patient is willing to undergo pre-treatment biopsy (for central confirmation of molecular alteration and PTEN immunohistochemical assessment) if adequate archival tissue is unavailable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient provided test result from CLIA certified laboratory, confirming somatic KRAS G12R mutation or archival tumor sample for KRAS analysis or be willing to undergo mandatory screening biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient agree to provide archival tumor material for research and must agree to undergo research tumor biopsy before treatment if presence of easily accessible lesions (judged by the treating physician)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo a fresh biopsy or is sufficient tissue available from within the last 3 months while on the same TKI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the H&E slide and FFPE tumor tissue block be available to be sent for central pathology review after registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo a fresh biopsy or is sufficient tissue available following progression while on the same TKI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is FFPE tumor tissue block available to be sent for central pathology review for confirmation of histology and MGMT promoter methylation status

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient, who is enrolled in the expansion cohort portion of study, have archival tumor tissue available for analysis and willing to have tumor biopsy at baseline (after registration and prior to starting treatment), at cycle 1, day 2 and cycle 2 day 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is FFPE tumor tissue block and H&E stained slide available to be sent for central pathology review for confirmation of histology and MGMT promoter methylation status

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tumor tissue available at time of enrollment or is patient willing to undergo a biopsy for integrated biomarker studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-enrollment archival tumor tissue available or patient is willing to undergo a biopsy for integrated biomarker studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is adequate archival specimen less than 6 weeks old available for submission to ETCTN Biorepository or patient has sufficient tumor and is willing to undergo an endometrial pipelle biopsy prior to beginning of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to provide archival tissue block or unstained tumor tissue or be willing to undergo biopsy to collect samples for retrospective central pathology review?
